front.title: The Real Time Transport Protocol (RTP) Denial of Service (Dos) Attack and its Prevention(

abstract.t: The Real Time Transport Protocol (RTP) provides unreliable transport of real time media from a sender to one or more recipients. RTP sessions are typically set up through signaling protocols such as the Session Initiation Protocol (SIP) or the Real Time Streaming Protocol (RTSP). When RTP is set up with these protocols, a potential Denial of Service (DoS) attack is introduced. This attack allows an attacker to cause a flood of RTP packets to be sent towards a target. We describe this attack, and also show how it is effectively prevented using Interactive Connectivity Establishment (ICE), first introduced as a means of handling Network Address Translator (NAT) traversal.
